title: Mum accused of murdering two daughters after 'bloody hammer' found near bodies
text:

A mother has been charged with murder after a 'bloody hammer' was found near the bodies of her two children.

Milka Djurasovic, 38, is accused of killing Tiana Djurasovic, six, and 10-year-old Mia in Perth, Australia, on Friday.

Djurasovic, described as a 'lovely mum', was found suffering from self-inflicted wounds at a nearby beach car park - around two hours after the girls' bodies were discovered.

Their father cried out in pain when he walked into the family home and saw the bloody scene, reports say.

(Image: 7 News)

Philip Couper, whose daughter was friends with Mia, told Mail Online that his wife used to go for coffee dates with Djurasovic.

He told Mail Online: "People are just trying to understand why because as far as everyone knew Milka was a lovely mum.

"Milka loved her girls, she was a great mum. We don't know how this could have happened."

(Image: AAP/PA Images)

(Image: 7 News)

Mr Couper said Djurasovic stopped taking her kids to school earlier this term, with either their granddad or dad stepping in.

He added that his wife had gone through her texts with Djurasovic and could not find any indication of mental illness or family issues.

Parents of pupils at Ashdale school were called into a meeting on Monday morning to inform them of the tragedy.

Mr Couper said other mums and dads were distraught about the news - and said his own daughter was 'traumatised' after hearing about her best friend's death.

The child left a teddy saying 'I love you' next to bouquets of flowers outside Djurasovic's home.
description: Tiana and Mia Djurasovic's father cried out in pain after finding the bloody scene at the family's home in Perth, Australia
